name: Dashing Nineties: R.M.D.
description:
Alternative Russia in 90's from Dashing Nineties: R.M.D. looks just like real. With one exception: there is less violence by the way. But the country still have a bad time: the Soviet Union has just collapsed and people finally get the freedom the wanted for so long.

In Siberian town Barnaul was opened the new branch of foreign corporation RMD. The director has very large plans that are hard to understand. And it will change the lives of main characters: Courier - simple guy who deliver not completely legal goods, and Operative - elderly policeman that isn't used to freedom. Drugs, blood, death - can the characters go through with it?

Dashing Nineties: R.M.D. is a story about how we see the 90's, we - the new generation. Despite the events have nothing to do with reality and any reference is purely coincidental, the point of the story doesn't outstrip reality.
